field.name: Date - contribution
field.definition: the date of a contributor's contribution

dos.practice: Enter a date to signify when a important contribution has been made.
Use a date format of YYYY-MM-DD, e.g. 2004-12-27.
Enter a year for every date entered.
Catalogers should always include a date.

donts.practice: Do not enter days of the week.
Do not enter just months or days.

otherPractice.header: Have complicated date information? Do this
otherPractice.practice: The following is an example of multiple dates for an NSF announcement. For a research science and science curriculum funding announcement, the research science might have a due date of 2005-07-31 while the science curriculum might have a due date of 2005-08-31. So enter the dates separately. Select Due date as the type of date and then complete different date descriptions. For this case, the date descriptions can be research science track and science curriculum track.

otherPractice.header: Want to enter a time? Do this.
otherPractice.practice: Use time only on those dates in which the year, month and day are known.

practice.link1: convert from local to Universal Coordinated Time (UTC)

otherPractice.practice: Enter time in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC). If help is needed to determine UTC, please see how to convert from local to Universal Coordinated Time (UTC).

Add the time component in the following format Thh:mm:ssZ. This looks like: 2004-12-27T18:00:00Z for December 27, 2004 at 5pm if entering a time for Boulder Colorado. Notice the capital letter T to signal that time is being entered and the ending Z to indicate Universal Coordinated Time (UTC or Zulu).

notes.note: This field is an attribute on the contributor field.
